intro: Schnabelia nepetifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf snakeweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
